entry.title: Physics Dissertation Defense
entry.summary: Josh Marvil, doctoral student in the Department of Physics, will defend his dissertation, "The Radio Continuum of Star-Forming Galaxies: New Observations and Analysis." This project is a two-part investigation into the radio continuum of local galaxies, the purpose of which is to better understand how spectral features are related to physical conditions and star formation activity. 9 a.m. at the NRAO.
entry.content: Josh Marvil, doctoral student in the Department of Physics, will defend his dissertation, "The Radio Continuum of Star-Forming Galaxies: New Observations and Analysis." This project is a two-part investigation into the radio continuum of local galaxies, the purpose of which is to better understand how spectral features are related to physical conditions and star formation activity. 9 a.m. at the NRAO.

entry.title: Earth Science Thesis Defense
entry.summary: Emily Woolsey, master's student in the Earth and Environmental Science Department, will defend her thesis. Her presentation is titled "Hydrologic Modeling Assessment of Deep Regional Flow Systems Within The Albuquerque Basin Using Thermal, Geochemical, and Geomechanical Tracers." 2 p.m. in MSEC 105.
entry.content: Emily Woolsey, master's student in the Earth and Environmental Science Department, will defend her thesis. Her presentation is titled "Hydrologic Modeling Assessment of Deep Regional Flow Systems Within The Albuquerque Basin Using Thermal, Geochemical, and Geomechanical Tracers." 2 p.m. in MSEC 105.

entry.title: 4th of July Concert & Fireworks
entry.summary: New Mexico Tech Performing Arts Series and EMRTC present a day of excellent New Mexico music, family fun, jump balloons, water slides, and food vendors, culminating in a spectacular fireworks display. Free admission. 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. North of Macey Center. Please bring your own chairs and do not bring fireworks to this site. For more information, visit: http://www.nmtpas.org.
entry.content: New Mexico Tech Performing Arts Series and EMRTC present a day of excellent New Mexico music, family fun, jump balloons, water slides, and food vendors, culminating in a spectacular fireworks display. Free admission. 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. North of Macey Center. Please bring your own chairs and do not bring fireworks to this site. For more information, visit: http://www.nmtpas.org.

entry.title: SGA Pool Party
entry.summary: The pool party is open to all students and the community. There will be free food, music and tons of summer fun. So come out and make a splash on independence day! This event will be from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at the NMT pool.
entry.content: The pool party is open to all students and the community. There will be free food, music and tons of summer fun. So come out and make a splash on independence day! This event will be from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. at the NMT pool.

entry.title: Summer Science Program: Open Event
entry.summary: The Summer Science Program offers weekly free lectures over the six-week course, which are open to the Tech community (students, faculty, staff and alumni). This week's featured speaker is Dr. Ingeborg Heyer, assistant professor at Loyola University. The talk is titled "Astronomy Through the Ages." 2:30 p.m. in Weir 102.
entry.content: The Summer Science Program offers weekly free lectures over the six-week course, which are open to the Tech community (students, faculty, staff and alumni). This week's featured speaker is Dr. Ingeborg Heyer, assistant professor at Loyola University. The talk is titled "Astronomy Through the Ages." 2:30 p.m. in Weir 102.

entry.title: Summer Science Program: Open Event
entry.summary: The Summer Science Program offers weekly free lectures over the six-week course, which are open to the Tech community (students, faculty, staff and alumni). This week's featured speaker is Dr. Sigrid Close, professor of aeronautics and astronautics at Stanford University. She will present "Meteoroids and Asteroids: Micro- to Macro-Impactors." 2:30 p.m. in Weir 102.
entry.content: The Summer Science Program offers weekly free lectures over the six-week course, which are open to the Tech community (students, faculty, staff and alumni). This week's featured speaker is Dr. Sigrid Close, professor of aeronautics and astronautics at Stanford University. entry.title: SGA Summer Meetings
entry.summary: Yes, the Student Government Association is meeting for the summer. We are working on issues and still passing bills. So if you do need to talk with us, just come to our meeting! 5 p.m. in the SGA Offices in the Fidel Center.
entry.content: Yes, the Student Government Association is meeting for the summer. We are working on issues and still passing bills. So if you do need to talk with us, just come to our meeting! 5 p.m. in the SGA Offices in the Fidel Center.

entry.title: Electrical Engineering Thesis Defense
entry.summary: Daniel Guillette, master's student in electrical engineering, will defend his thesis, titled "Embedded Electrical Wire Bus in 3D Printed Structure", at 2 p.m. Wednesday, July 15, in Workman 205.
entry.content: Daniel Guillette, master's student in electrical engineering, will defend his thesis, titled "Embedded Electrical Wire Bus in 3D Printed Structure", at 2 p.m. Wednesday, July 15, in Workman 205.

entry.title: Summer Science Program: Open Event
entry.summary: The Summer Science Program offers weekly free lectures over the six-week course, which are open to the Tech community (students, faculty, staff and alumni). This week's featured speaker is Dr. Dara Norman, associate scientist at the National Optical Astronomy Observatory. Her talk is titled, "Nature and Nurture in Understanding Active Galactic Nuclei." 10:30 a.m. in Weir 102.

entry.title: Blood Drive
entry.summary: Residential Life is sponsoring a blood drive from 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Friday, July 18, in the third floor ballrooms of the Fidel Center. Students, employees and local residents are all welcome to participate. Call 505-246-1457 or 575-835-5900 or go on the web at www.unitedbloodservices.org and enter the sponsor code NMT to reserve a time slot. Those who donate will be entered to win a LifeXtend Certified Convertible PT Cruiser from ReCARnation! Location: Fidel Center ate and Time: July 18th 10:30am Duration: 5 hours
entry.content: Residential Life is sponsoring a blood drive from 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Friday, July 18, in the third floor ballrooms of the Fidel Center. Students, employees and local residents are all welcome to participate. Call 505-246-1457 or 575-835-5900 or go on the web at www.unitedbloodservices.org and enter the sponsor code NMT to reserve a time slot. Those who donate will be entered to win a LifeXtend Certified Convertible PT Cruiser from ReCARnation! Location: Fidel Center ate and Time: July 18th 10:30am Duration: 5 hours
